snippet: Iran has told its Syrian ally it will not tolerate the breaking of the "axis of resistance". But, in a hostile world, how far can Tehran go to protect a regime whose downfall would leave it further isolated?
abstract: Iran has told its Syrian ally it will not tolerate the breaking of the "axis of resistance". But, in a hostile world, how far can Tehran go to protect a regime whose downfall would leave it further isolated?

headline.main: What Syria Looks Like From Tehran
